The proof of Bayes’ theorem is no more than an exercise in substituting
the definition of conditional probability into the formula, and applying
the total probability theorem.
$$\frac{{{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{B\right\}}}{{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{E|B\right\}}}}{\sum_i {{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{A_i\right\}}}{{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{E|A_i\right\}}}} =
\frac{{{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{E\cap B\right\}}}}{\sum_i {{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{E\cap A_i\right\}}}} =
= \frac{{{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{E\cap B\right\}}}}{{{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{E\right\}}}} = {{\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{B|E\right\}}}.$$
